name: Recurrent Laryngeal Nerve Palsy
chief_complaint: My voice has been hoarse for weeks, and sometimes I choke when drinking water
physical_findings: asymmetrical vocal cord movement on laryngoscopy
prognosis: Variable - may resolve spontaneously if caused by viral illness, but can be permanent if nerve damage is severe
description: Unilateral paralysis of the recurrent laryngeal nerve causing vocal cord dysfunction. May result from viral infections, surgical trauma (especially thyroid surgery), or compressive lesions. Left side more commonly affected due to longer nerve course.
